snippet: An essay contest from The Ethicist stirs a fuss among vegetarians and meat-eaters.
abstract: Arthur S Brisbane The Public Editor column questions the value of The New York Times Magazine essay contest on the ethics of eating meat, which was feature in The Ethicist column. (M)
lead_paragraph: COUNT on The New York Times to take a basic topic and vault it into the stratosphere of esoteric, philosophic discussion. Food, for instance. Other daily newspapers and Web sites tell you about restaurants, recipes and diet. The Times does that, of course. But it also tells you about the ethics of eating. Whether you like it or not.

headline.main: In the Middle of a Food Fight
